meanings.definition: A large crowd of people, especially one that is disorderly and intent on causing trouble or violence.
meanings.sent1: The mob gathered outside the store, shouting and pushing.
meanings.sent2: The mob at the concert was so loud and rowdy.
meanings.sent3: The mob of kids ran around the playground, laughing and playing.
meanings.sent4: The mob of storm clouds gathered ominously in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The mob of protesters marched through the streets, demanding change.

meanings.definition: A group of people who share a common interest or purpose, typically one that is unruly or disorganized.
meanings.sent1: The book club turned into a mob of avid readers discussing their favorite novels.
meanings.sent2: The mob of gamers stayed up all night playing online together.
meanings.sent3: The mob of friends planned a surprise party for their buddy.
meanings.sent4: The mob of fans cheered wildly at the sports game.
meanings.sent5: The mob of volunteers worked tirelessly to clean up the park.

meanings.definition: To crowd around (someone) in an unruly and excitable way.
meanings.sent1: The excited fans mobbed the celebrity as soon as they saw him.
meanings.sent2: The paparazzi mobbed the actress as she left the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The kids mobbed the ice cream truck when it arrived in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The reporters mobbed the politician with questions at the press conference.
meanings.sent5: The shoppers mobbed the store during the big sale.
